content:
My main interest consists of neuronal modelling and data analysis, with use of Machine Learning inspired techniques and particular interest in Bayesian Inference applications.
Currently pursuing a Master of Science in Neuroengineering at Technical University of Munich. At the moment working for INCF with Brian 2 as a part of Google Summer of Code, where I develop a new Model Fitting Toolbox, aiming to fit traces and spike trains to neuronal models.
Previously a research assistant at Prof. Herz lab for Computational Neuroscience, working on data inference in single cell model. During my Master I also contributed to the ratCAVE project of Prof. Sirota lab at LMU.
Previously a Technical Student at CERN.

title: Aleksandra Teska
